full_title: man at the garden by Kendrick Lamar
title: man at the garden

description.plain:
The title “man at the garden” seems to refer to the story of a man who is listing the things he did to deserve to enter the “garden,” symbolizing biblical paradise. Kendrick repeats the phrase “I deserve it all” throughout the track to accredit the things he’s done to reach the garden.

This song is a manifesto of Kendrick’s life philosophy: he deserves everything he’s earned because of the sacrifices he’s made, the principles he’s upheld, and the struggles he’s overcome. It’s also a challenge for listeners to reflect on their own lives and consider what they’ve done to claim their success or “deserve it all.”

Kendrick also pays homage to Nas with this track (previously commended in “wacced out murals”) as the production, rapping cadence, and themes match that of “One Mic,” a song which came at the height of Nas' beef with JAY-Z. In referencing “One Mic,” Kendrick parallels Jay and Nas' rivalry with his and Drake’s.

embed_content: Read “man at the garden” by Kendrick Lamar on Genius
recording_location: Electric Lady Studios (New York, NY), Conway Recording Studios (Los Angeles, CA), Tamarind (Los Angeles, CA)
